name: B. Outstanding Impressionist
input: InputEach test contains multiple test cases. The first line of the input contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \leq t \leq 10^4$$$) — the number of test cases. The description of test cases follows.The first line of each test case contains a single integer $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \leq n \leq 2\cdot 10^5$$$) — the number of impressions.Then $$$n$$$ lines follow, the $$$i$$$-th containing two integers $$$l_i$$$ and $$$r_i$$$ ($$$1 \leq l_i \leq r_i \leq 2\cdot n$$$) — the minimum possible value and the maximum possible value of $$$w_i$$$.It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$n$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$2\cdot 10^5$$$.
output: OutputFor each test case, output a binary string $$$s$$$ of length $$$n$$$: for each $$$1 \leq i \leq n$$$, if impression $$$i$$$ is unique, $$$s_i=\texttt{1}$$$; otherwise, $$$s_i=\texttt{0}$$$. Do not output spaces.
description: B. Outstanding Impressionisttime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard output
